meanings.definition: The office or department of a chancellor.
meanings.sent1: The chancellories were filled with important documents and paperwork.
meanings.sent2: The chancellories were located on the top floor of the government building.
meanings.sent3: The chancellories were so busy that they needed extra staff to keep up.
meanings.sent4: The chancellories stood as the heart of the administrative operations.
meanings.sent5: The chancellories buzzed with activity from early morning till late at night.

meanings.definition: The building or room used by a chancellor.
meanings.sent1: The grand chancellories were adorned with elegant tapestries and furniture.
meanings.sent2: The chancellor's chancellories overlooked the beautiful garden outside.
meanings.sent3: The chancellories were so cozy that the chancellor often took naps there.
meanings.sent4: The chancellories symbolized power and authority within the palace walls.
meanings.sent5: The chancellories echoed with the footsteps of the chancellor as he paced back and forth.
